body: I would recommend avoid/solve this problem by extending Filter, a filter like ExceptionFilter may solve this problem, detailed violations don't need to send to consumer side.
I will close this PR now.
close via #1885

If this PR only support specify a specific unit at startup, I think that makes no difference with Dubbo's group.

I think we should consider the following aspects as a whole:
* The initial call decides the whole invoke chain automatically.
* We may need some support from third-party infrastructures, such as systems that can group instances automatically based on instance IP.
* Support change group/unit of an instance dynamically at runtime.
* Support adds routing rules dynamically at runtime.
I will close this PR temporarily, and will reopen it or create a new ticket to track this feature later.

dubbo.jar includes all dubbo relevant files but doesn't include its dependencies, that means, you need to explicitly include the desired dependencies by yourself. For your convenience, you can import the following bom to simplify this part of work:

```xml
    <dependencyManagement>
        <dependencies>
            <dependency>
                <groupId>com.alibaba</groupId>
                <artifactId>dubbo-dependencies-bom</artifactId>
                <version>${dubbo.version}</version>
                <type>pom</type>
                <scope>import</scope>
            </dependency>
        </dependencies>
    </dependencyManagement>
```

@lovepoem I will pick up this.

You can't invoke services between groupA and groupB.
Until now, one group is designed to be an independent and isolated cluster, cause in a registry center a group has a root path that is not the same one from another. The a consumer will never see a provider in other group.
In your case, the provider in group A send its metadata to zk in path /A/....
And then the consumer in group B will fetch metadata from zk in path /B/....
So consumer can't find demoService provider.

application.properties或者application.yml中，加了这个没？apollo.bootstrap.enabled=true

回复  EonianGlutton ：
项目用的是spring boot  配合 apollo配置中心 一起使用，项目没有 dubbo.properties配置文件，而且application.properties或者application.yml 没有任何dubbo方面的配置，所有配置被转移到 apollo。但是spring.application.name 、dubbo.protocol.port之类的参数，配置在 apollo 中正正常被系统拉取到。但唯独  dubbo.application.qos.enable 和  dubbo.application.qos.port 配置无效。
不过刚刚经过自己查看 dubbo配置方面的源代码，尝试性的在 apollo中将 dubbo.application.qos.enable 配置改成  dubbo.application.qosEnable 这个，问题得到解决。
总结：解决 pos方面的配置写到 apollo配置中心无效的方法是把， dubbo.application.qos.enable 配置改成  dubbo.application.qosEnable，同理，如果想替换默认端口，需要把  dubbo.application.qos.port 改成  dubbo.application.qosPort
